item.title: About
item.description: I am a graduate student in epidemiology in the Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public Health. Iâ€™m interested in using epidemiologic methods to identify targeted interventions for high risk populations. Before starting my doctoral degree, I worked in the London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine studying cancer survival disparities in the UK, France and Japan. For my doctoral thesis, I am working on using both infectious disease modeling and machine learning techniques to inform tuberculosis control strategies.

item.title: Research
item.description: Active projects TB contact investigation in Peru As part of my doctoral thesis, I’m developing tools that could inform tuberculosis contact investigation and preventive therapy for pulmonary TB patients and their contacts in Lima, Peru with Prof. Megan Murray. Some preliminary results were presented on the 16th Annual Jonathan Freeman Symposium on Infectious Disease Epidemiology on Apr 27, 2018.
